p: Adaptive immunity is also modulated by plant polysaccharides. Particularly, Fan et al. have shown that polysaccharides from A. membranaceus significantly up-regulated the proliferation of B lymphocytes, probably through the interaction with immunoglobulin on the surface of B cells [ 115, 116, 117]. A. membranaceus polysaccharides were also able to increase the number of CD3+CD4+CD8+ memory T helper (Th) cells and CD3+CD4-CD8+ cytotoxic T cells [ 111]. Moreover, they also enhance the CD4+/CD8+ T cell ratio [ 118]. Furthermore, arabinoxylan were found to increase the activation of T- and B-cells and humoral and cell-mediated immunity in tumor bearing mice [ 71].
